qas.question: When did the mandolin's poplarity rebound?

answers.text: Beginning with the Paris Exposition of 1878

qas.question: What popular group performed at the Paris Exposition?
When was it said that mandolin's popularity peaked?
What instrument was the mandolin confused with during the 1880's?
What were formed worldwide that incorporated the mandolin famiy of instruments and other instruments as well?
What instrument did the violin become confused with?
What group of people traveled to the United States in 1880?
What group of people traveled to Europe in 1890?

plausible_answers.text: Beginning with the Paris Exposition of 1878

qas.question: When did the mandolin's poplarity not rebound?
What popular group didn't perform at the Paris Exposition?
When was it said that mandolin's popularity sank?
What instrument was the mandolin never confused with during the 1880's?
What were formed worldwide that incorporated the mandolin family of instruments but no other instruments as well?

context: <a0_0><b9_0>Beginning with the <b5_0>Paris Exposition<b5_0/> of 1878<b9_0/><a0_0/>, the instrument's popularity rebounded. The Exposition was one of many stops for a popular new performing group the <a1_0><b10_0>Estudiantes Españoles<b10_0/> (Spanish Students)<a1_0/>. They danced and played guitars, violins and the <a3_0><b12_0>bandurria<b12_0/><a3_0/>, which became confused with the <b6_0>mandolin<b6_0/>. Along with the energy and awareness created by the day's hit sensation, a wave of <b7_0>Italian mandolinists<b7_0/> travelled <b8_0>Europe<b8_0/> in the 1880s and 1890s and in the United States by the mid-1880s, playing and teaching their instrument. The instrument's popularity continued to increase during the 1890s and mandolin popularity was at its height in "<a2_0><b11_0>early years of the 20th century<b11_0/>.<a2_0/>" Thousands were taking up the instrument as a pastime, and it became an instrument of society, taken up by young men and women. <a4_0><b13_0>Mandolin orchestras<b13_0/><a4_0/> were formed worldwide, incorporating not only the mandolin family of instruments, but also guitars, double basses and zithers.
